alert.note: Alert for Northern Westchester; Putnam; Rockland (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 12 at 2:35PM EST by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...MODERATE TO BRIEFLY HEAVY SNOW POSSIBLE THIS AFTERNOON... A band of moderate to briefly heavy snow will move into the area between 300 PM and 330 PM. Visibilities may be quickly reduced to 1/2 mile or less at times as gusty northwest winds continue. An additional 1 to 2 inches of snowfall is possible before the snow tapers off and ends late this afternoon into early this evening. A Winter Weather Advisory remains in effect until 700 PM EST. Wind gusts of 45 to 50 mph are likely this afternoon into tonight, and a Wind Advisory remains in effect until 400 AM EDT. Temperatures around freezing continue to fall, and will be in the mid 20s by early this evening, and reach lows of 15 to 20 degrees overnight. Gusty northwest wind will produce wind chill values in the single digits through tonight. Motorists should exercise extra caution as snow develops and be prepared for rapid changes in visibility. Also, untreated surfaces may become slippery this afternoon and this evening as temperatures continue to fall.
